definitions.definition: a device that gives out light in which all the waves oscillate (= change direction and strength) together, typically producing a powerful beam of light that can be used for cutting metal, in medical operations, etc.

examples.text: The barcodes on the products are read by lasers.
She's had **laser surgery** on her eye.

wordOrigin: 1960s: acronym from light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation, on the pattern of maser.
